title: From Cliché Advice to What No One is Saying...
description:
I Googled "Doubting My Salvation" and spent a day taking notes on the most popular advice out there...

When I was a kid I asked God to save me over and over again. And even as an adult, I can still wonder if I have the right kind of belief to be saved. I want to be confident of my salvation, but sometimes I feel scared and unsure.

So, let’s synthesize what’s out there and analyze it together! What's helpful and what's not? What’s been said 100 times and what hasn't been said at all?

title: Recovering an Accurate View of Scripture - Pt. 2 with Dr. Licona
description:
In some ways discussing the inspiration and inerrancy of Scripture feels like discussing the Trinity. It’s confusing and messy, and you’ll probably say something wrong, so maybe it's best to not say much at all? But that fear allows our false assumptions about the Bible to go unchallenged! I’m grateful that Dr. Licona encouraged me to share our honest, but uncomfortable dialogue about the inspiration and inerrancy of Scripture. Please enjoy the conversation.

description:

I don’t want someone else to feel the way I do! Will expressing our doubts harm others? When should we share our doubts or not? How contagious is doubt?

Deep dive on finding safe, healthy places to express doubt: https://youtu.be/iLb2mhV4J40

description:
In this episode I talk with Dr. Jana Harmon, author of Atheists Finding God. For her book (and PhD) she interviewed 50 former atheists because she wanted to know, what would it take for an atheist to believe in Christianity? I thought that topic might be of interest to those who are wondering about themselves, what would it take for me to believe?

Dr. Harmon has spent countless hours considering what motivates people to make life-altering changes to their worldview, so stick around until the end to hear Dr. Harmon's heartfelt advice to those who are wrestling with doubt. Enjoy the conversation!

title: Questioning How We Were Raised Without Losing Faith - with Natalie
description:
If you're doubting your faith, you're in the right place because Truth Snack journeys with doubting Christians toward confident faith.

We're kicking off Season 2 by talking Natalie, someone I met this summer. We were working at a summer camp and she told me she was raised in a church that taught jewellery, make-up, and sports were all wrong. Our activities at camp that day happened to be... making bracelets, face-painting, and football!

I couldn't help but wonder how Natalie was able to question so much of what she was raised to believe while holding onto faith in Jesus. She calls her process "disentangling," and her minister, Berean Holiness, helps others do the same. Enjoy the conversation!

Find out more about Natalie's work at www.BereanHoliness.com.

title: Growing in Our Relationship with God
description:
Download all three episodes, discussion questions, and more: https://doubterswelcome.ck.page/encounteringgod

When I was doubting I thought, "If God would just show up, that would put all my doubts to rest!" But that's not how the Bible portrays our encounters with God. Surprisingly, when God shows up there is a wide range of ways we may respond. So it's worth asking how we be more receptive when God shows up in our lives.

In this series we’ll discuss:

Why Encounter Matters
Recognizing God’s Voice
Growing in Our Relationship

If you’re ready for an honest discussion about encountering God, this series is for you!

#EncounteringGod #Doubt #Deconstruction #Faith #FaithReconstruction

Sometimes people will say God spoke to them or that they felt God’s presence. And you might think to yourself, “That sounds awesome... but how did you know that was God?!" I know I've thought that, so I called some of my mentors and asked them how they recognize God.

In this series we’ll discuss:

Why Encounter Matters
Recognizing God’s Voice
Growing in Our Relationship

If you’re ready for an honest discussion about encountering God, this series is for you!

title: Doubt's Recipe: Setting Conditions for Discipleship, Not Doubt - at Implementa
description:
Welcome to the Truth Snack podcast! 

If you’re doubting or deconstructing, you’re in the right place! Truth Snack journeys with doubting Christians toward confident faith. 

In this episode we explore bad theology that gets taught in churches and can contribute to a recipe for doubt. 

Have we encountered these teachings? Have they created a "doubt recipe" in us? And most humbling of all: have we ever been the ones teaching it to others? I invite you to listen in, join the adventurous truth seeking, and don’t hesitate to share you thoughts with me at matt@truthsnack.ca.

Truth Snack is about journeying with doubting Christians toward confident faith. I hope this episode can be a little truth snack to help you on your way.

title: Making Sense of Divine Destruction Stories - with Jonny
description:
How do we make sense of divine destruction in the Bible? What distortions do we bring to the Bible that make it hard to understand? If the Bible is so complicated, why follow Jesus?


In this episode I talk with my friend Jonny who is studying the Old Testament in pursuit of a PhD. In particular, he’s studying stories of divine destruction in the Old Testament— that’s right, he’s chosen to study the uncomfortable stories that can make us question God's goodness.

Jonny's perspective was insightful and challenging. I have no doubt this chat some wisdom to offer you on your journey through doubt. Enjoy!

description:
How to Hear God through the Bible -  https://youtu.be/iwtyhrQiWSk
Removing Barriers to Hearing God - https://youtu.be/rOvrhkip1lg

If we want to hear God through the Bible, I think we need to read it while holding two questions in tension:

1. What has God said through Scripture?
2. What is God saying to me now?

But what do we lose when we don't keep these in tension? That's what this livestream is about! As always, your thoughts and input are welcome.

#HearingGod #EncounteringGod

title: Can We Hear God Through the Bible?

This year Truth Snack is exploring how encounter with God can anchor our faith, even during times of doubt. Your thoughts and input are INVITED! We're on this journey of #AdventurousTruthSeeking together.

CORRECTION:

In this video, I said, "Translations of the New Testament are made from manuscripts that were copied much closer to the time of the originals than any other ancient document that historians trust." That statement is not accurate. I've learned there are some documents with earlier copies. It would have been more accurate for me to say "many other ancient documents" instead of "any other ancient documents." That being said, I believe the conclusion expressed by Dr. Wallace stands.

title: Why Care About Human Rights?
description:
Like most people, I've been doing a lot of thinking about what it takes to live in a just, free, and peaceful world. A recent, eye-opening experience changed my perspective in a meaningful way!

In order to keep this video focused and streamlined I was not able to speak at length on my ontological beliefs regarding human rights. I believe that all moral obligations and 'goodness' (whether affirmed by documents like the Universal Declaration of Human Rights or not) find their source in the perfect character of God, can be known through the word of God, and are perfectly displayed by Jesus Christ. While I personally believe that documents like The Universal Declaration of Human Rights and The Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms do provide objectively moral principles, the conversation about the moral nature of 'Human Rights' must be ongoing.

I thoroughly enjoy the deep philosophical work it takes to think clearly on this topic. It certainly isn't easy. If you're interested in more of my thoughts  on God and objective morality, please watch this video: https://youtu.be/92QyRZjgX4c

title: Is Jesus' Resurrection A Copy of Pagan Myths?
description:

This talk was originally given at No Other name 2019 which is a youth conference held in Ottawa, Canada.

title: Did Jesus Claim to be God?
description:
We may have our own opinion on the question, but what did Jesus' friends and enemies think? Did Jesus claim divinity? 

When addressing the claims of Jesus, we need to make sure we're hearing them with the "ears" of his original context. Jesus was a brilliant communicator, but he was speaking to those who lived thousands of years ago, so context is key!

How the crowd reacted to Jesus' claims to being one with God, being able to forgive sins, and using God's name as his own says a lot about what Jesus was really trying to say.
